text: (21:37) “If a man steals an ox or a sheep and kills it or sells it, he must pay back five head of cattle for the ox, and four sheep for the one sheep.
“If a thief is caught breaking in and is struck so that he dies, there will be no blood guilt for him.

<st data-num="0518">If</st> the <st data-num="08121" class="">sun</st> has <st data-num="02224" class="">risen</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> him, then there is <st data-num="01818" class="">blood guilt</st> for him. A thief<n id="1" /> must <st data-num="07999" class="">surely</st> <st data-num="07999" class="">make full restitution</st>; <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> he has <st data-num="0369" class="">nothing</st>, then he will be <st data-num="04376" class="">sold</st> for his <st data-num="01591" class="">theft</st>.
If the stolen item should in fact be found alive in his possession, whether it be an ox or a donkey or a sheep, he must pay back double.

“If a man grazes his livestock in a field or a vineyard and he lets the livestock loose and they graze in the field of another man, he must make restitution from the best of his own field and the best of his own vineyard.
“If a fire breaks out and spreads to thorn bushes, so that stacked grain or standing grain or the whole field is consumed, the one who started the fire must surely make restitution.
“If a man gives his neighbor money or articles for safekeeping and it is stolen from the man’s house, if the thief is caught, he must repay double.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> the <st data-num="01590" class="">thief</st> is <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="04672" class="">caught</st>,<n id="1" /> then the <st data-num="01167" class="">owner</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> will be <st data-num="07126" class="">brought</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">before</st> the <st data-num="0430" class="">judges</st><n id="2" /> to see<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0518" class="">whether</st> he has <st data-num="07971" class="">laid</st><n id="4" /> his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> on his <st data-num="07453" class="">neighbor’s</st> <st data-num="04399" class="">goods</st>.

<st data-num="05921" class="">In</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">cases</st> of <st data-num="06588" class="">illegal possessions</st>,<n id="1" /> whether <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> an <st data-num="07794" class="">ox</st>, a <st data-num="02543" class="">donkey</st>, a <st data-num="07716" class="">sheep</st>, a <st data-num="08008" class="">garment</st>, or <st data-num="03605" class="">any kind</st> of <st data-num="09" class="">lost item</st>, about <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> someone <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st> ‘<st data-num="02088" class="">This</st> belongs to <st data-num="01931" class="">me</st>,’<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01697" class="">matter</st> of the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> of them will <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">before</st> the <st data-num="0430" class="">judges</st>,<n id="3" /> and the one <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st><n id="4" /> the <st data-num="0430" class="">judges</st> <st data-num="07561" class="">declare guilty</st><n id="5" /> must <st data-num="07999" class="">repay</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">double</st> to his <st data-num="07453" class="">neighbor</st>.

<st data-num="03588" class="">If</st> a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">gives</st> his <st data-num="07453" class="">neighbor</st> a <st data-num="02543" class="">donkey</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> an <st data-num="07794" class="">ox</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> a <st data-num="07716" class="">sheep</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> <st data-num="0929" class="">beast</st> to <st data-num="08104" class="">keep</st>, and it <st data-num="04191" class="">dies</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> is <st data-num="07665" class="">injured</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> is <st data-num="07617" class="">carried away</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0369" class="">without</st> anyone <st data-num="07200" class="">seeing</st> it,<n id="3" />
then there will be an oath to the Lord between the two of them, that he has not laid his hand on his neighbor’s goods, and its owner will accept this, and he will not have to pay.

But <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> it was <st data-num="01589" class="">stolen</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05973" class="">from</st> him,<n id="2" /> he will <st data-num="07999" class="">pay</st> its <st data-num="01167" class="">owner</st>.
If it is torn in pieces, then he will bring it for evidence, and he will not have to pay for what was torn.
“If a man borrows an animal from his neighbor and it is hurt or dies when its owner was not with it, the man who borrowed it will surely pay.
If its owner was with it, he will not have to pay; if it was hired, what was paid for the hire covers it.
“If a man seduces a virgin who is not engaged and goes to bed with her, he must surely pay the marriage price for her to be his wife.
If her father refuses to give her to him, he must pay money for the bride price of virgins.
“You must not allow a sorceress to live.
“Whoever has sexual relations with a beast must surely be put to death.
“Whoever sacrifices to a god other than the Lord alone must be utterly destroyed.
“You must not wrong a resident foreigner nor oppress him, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
“You must not afflict any widow or orphan.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> you <st data-num="06031" class="">afflict</st> them<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06031" class="">in any way</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588 0518" class="">and</st> they <st data-num="06817" class="">cry</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me, I will <st data-num="08085" class="">surely</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">hear</st><n id="3" /> their <st data-num="06818" class="">cry</st>,
and my anger will burn and I will kill you with the sword, and your wives will be widows and your children will be fatherless.
“If you lend money to any of my people who are needy among you, do not be like a moneylender to him; do not charge him interest.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> you <st data-num="02254" class="">do take</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="08008" class="">garment</st> of your <st data-num="07453" class="">neighbor</st> <st data-num="02254" class="">in pledge</st>, you must <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> it to him <st data-num="05704" class="">by the time</st> the <st data-num="08121" class="">sun</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">goes down</st>,<n id="2" />
for it is his only covering—it is his garment for his body. What else can he sleep in? And when he cries out to me, I will hear, for I am gracious.
“You must not blaspheme God or curse the ruler of your people.
“Do not hold back offerings from your granaries or your vats. You must give me the firstborn of your sons.
You must also do this for your oxen and for your sheep; seven days they may remain with their mothers, but give them to me on the eighth day.
“You will be holy people to me; you must not eat any meat torn by animals in the field. You must throw it to the dogs.
